front.title: Data Collection Requirements and Technologies for Digital Twin Network

abstract.t: A Digital Twin Network is a virtual representation of a physical network, which is meant to be used by a management system to analyze, diagnose, emulate and control the physical network based on monitoring information, data, models, and interfaces. The construction and state update of a Digital Twin Network require obtaining real-time information of the physical network it represents (i.e., telemetry data). This document aims to describe the data collection requirements and provide data collection methods or tools to build the data repository for building and updating a digital twin network.
